member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.GetSiteRoot(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset)
member.summary: For a given asset find the closest parent that is of FolderType.SiteRoot
member.param: The requested site root asset.
member.returns: The site root if found. If none is found returns an empty asset (IsLoaded will be false)

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.GetProject(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset)
member.summary: For a given asset find the project. If the asset is in a project or a child of a project that project will be returned. If the asset is a child of a site root, we will look for a project that is a child of a site root and that will be returned. If the asset is a child of a site root and does not have a child project, it will look for a sibling project to the site root and return that. If no project is found by either method, we will return an empty asset. If using a site root to find the project and more than one child or sibling is found which is a project, an error will be set and no project will be returned.
member.param: The requested project asset.
member.returns: The project if found. If none is found returns an empty asset (IsLoaded will be false)

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.RouteCollection(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Status,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Route assets in the given list of collection to a workflow step that corresponds to the given status. The status must correspond to one of the steps on the assets' workflow. If more than one workflow step has the given state, then the lowest step will be chosen. Use Status.Load(string statusName) to load the status. If it returns false, check the context.Error property. Currently, you may only route file assets, routing folders in not supported.
member.param: The list of Collection Ids to route the assets within them.
The status.
Applies only when workflow results in a publish. If true, dependencies will be computed and published if necessary.
member.returns: RouteResponse.

The status.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.GetPanels(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.SortOrder)

summary.para: Get panels based on list name from data already saved into the asset.

Note: The usual case is that the data for the panel comes from a List Panel on an input form. Once the form has been saved, this function will always return at least one entry, even if no data was entered on the panel. Therefore, you may want to check the data in the PanelEntry before using it, depending on the use case.

member.param: Name of the field on which to create the list
Optional: sort order, default is null. If null, the list will be in the order it was saved.
member.returns: The requested list of PanelEntries

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.GetPanelsFromFolder(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetParams,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetType,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Used for navigation lists. Panels are initialized using children of "this" asset instance or this instances parent, if this is a file.
Data from the panels is stored on this asset. This could be used, to store the order of the list or to associate other metadata such as enabled, disabled.
If there is more than one child from the same branch, the asset with the highest asset id is returned. Assets are bound to the panels by branch id unless the optional idName parameter is specified

This method is overloaded. This version would be the most common case where the metadata is stored on the same folder whose children we are using to initialize the list. If using this method to initialize an input panel, additional code is required on the post_input.aspx template to copy the data from the current asset to the folder. The other version would allow you to save the metadata on a different asset such as the current asset.

The optional idName and labelName parameters are for backward-compatibility with navigation panels stored with the old API. If an idName is specified, then the assets are bound to the panels by asset id instead of the branch id.
It is not necessary to add hidden fields with the id or branch id to the form, they are automatically generated.

member.param: The name of the panel
Optional: Used like in GetFileList or GetFolderList to filter data, etc.
Optional:Can be used to get back only a specific type of child - file or folder, defaults to AssetType.Unspecified which returns both
Optional:The string that will be used to store the folder's label when we store the panel data. Use lower case. Defaults to panelName + ".label"
Optional:The string that will be used to store the folder's id when we store the panel data. Use lower case. Defaults to panelName + ".id"
member.returns: A List of AssetPanelEntry objects

example.code:
<% // output example List panels = asset.GetPanelsFromFolder("folder_list"); foreach(AssetPanelEntry panel in panels) { Out.WriteLine("id=\"{0}\", Name=\"{1}\"
", panel["folder_list.id"], panel["folder_list.label"]); Out.WriteLine("Type: {0}
", panel.ChildAsset.Type); } //input example List panels2 = asset.GetPanelsFromFolder("folder_list"); AssetPanelEntry currentPanel; while(Input.NextPanel(panels2, out currentPanel)) { Input.ShowTextBox("Name", "folder_list.label"); Out.WriteLine("Type: {0}
", currentPanel.ChildAsset.Type); } //Exclude Retired and Archived Assets AssetParams assetParams = new AssetParams(); assetParams.ExcludeFilterStatus = Util.MakeList("Archived", "Retired"); List panels2 = asset.GetPanelsFromFolder("folder_list", assetParams); // Examples where you specify your own labelName and idName // output example List panels = asset.Parent.GetPanelsFromFolder( "folder_list", labelName: "folder_label", idName: "folder_id"); foreach(AssetPanelEntry panel in panels) { Out.WriteLine("id=\"{0}\", Name=\"{1}\"
", panel["folder_id"], panel["folder_label"]); Out.WriteLine("Type: {0}
", panel.ChildAsset.Type); } //input example List panels2 = asset.Parent.GetPanelsFromFolder( "folder_list", labelName: "folder_label", idName: "folder_id"); AssetPanelEntry currentPanel; while(Input.NextPanel(panels2, out currentPanel)) { Input.ShowTextBox("Name", "folder_label"); Out.WriteLine("Type: {0}
", currentPanel.ChildAsset.Type); } ///post_input example Asset folder = asset.Parent; string prefix = "folder_" ;// Use a string common to your panel name, idname, and label name. If you used the version were you DID NOT specify your own label name and idname, the panel name should work. Dictionary allContent = folder.GetContent(); foreach(KeyValuePair entry in allContent) { if (entry.Key.StartsWith(prefix)) { folder.DeleteContentField(entry.Key); } } Dictionary toFolder = new Dictionary(); foreach(KeyValuePair entry in context.InputForm) { if (entry.Key.StartsWith(prefix)) { toFolder.Add(entry.Key, entry.Value); } } context.InputForm.Remove(toFolder.Keys); folder.SaveContent(toFolder); %>

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.GetPanelsFromFolder(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset,System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetParams,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetType,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Used for navigation lists.

Panels are initialized using children of the first argument "folder" asset instance, which must be a folder. Data from the panels is stored on "this" asset. This could be used, to store the order of the list or to associate other metadata such as enabled, disabled.
If there is more than one child from the same branch, the asset with the highest asset id is returned. Assets are bound to the panels by branch id unless the optional idName parameter is specified

The optional idName and labelName parameters are for backward-compatibility with navigation panels stored with the old API. If an idName is specified, then the assets are bound to the panels by asset id instead of the branch id.
It is not necessary to add hidden fields with the id or branch id to the form, they are automatically generated.

If using this method to initialize an input panel, additional code is required on the post_input.aspx template to copy the data from the current asset to the folder (or other asset where you are storing the metadata), unless you are storing the data on the current asset that you are editing.

member.param: The folder whose children we will use to initialize the list
The name of the panel
Optional:Used like in GetFileList or GetFolderList to filter data, etc.
Optional:Can be used to get back only a specific type of child - file or folder, defaults to AssetType.Unspecified which returns both
Optional:The string that will be used to store the folder's label when we store the panel data. Use lower case. Defaults to panelName + ".label"
Optional:The string that will be used to store the folder's id when we store the panel data. Use lower case. Defaults to panelName + ".id"
member.returns: A List of AssetPanelEntry objects

example.code:
<% // output example List panels = asset.GetPanelsFromFolder(asset.Parent, "folder_list"); foreach(AssetPanelEntry panel in panels) { Out.WriteLine("id=\"{0}\", Name=\"{1}\"
", panel["folder_list.id"], panel["folder_list.label"]); Out.WriteLine("Type: {0}
", panel.ChildAsset.Type); } //input example List panels2 = asset.GetPanelsFromFolder(asset.Parent, "folder_list"); AssetPanelEntry currentPanel; while(Input.NextPanel(panels2, out currentPanel)) { Input.ShowTextBox("Name", "folder_list.label"); Out.WriteLine("Type: {0}
", currentPanel.ChildAsset.Type); } //Exclude Retired and Archived Assets AssetParams assetParams = new AssetParams(); assetParams.ExcludeFilterStatus = Util.MakeList("Archived", "Retired"); List panels2 = asset.GetPanelsFromFolder(asset.Parent, "folder_list", assetParams); // Examples where you specify your own labelName and idName // output example List panels = asset.GetPanelsFromFolder(asset.Parent, "folder_list", labelName: "folder_label", idName: "folder_id"); foreach(AssetPanelEntry panel in panels) { Out.WriteLine("id=\"{0}\", Name=\"{1}\"
", panel["folder_id"], panel["folder_label"]); Out.WriteLine("Type: {0}
", panel.ChildAsset.Type); } //input example List panels2 = asset.GetPanelsFromFolder(asset.Parent, "folder_list", labelName: "folder_label", idName: "folder_id"); AssetPanelEntry currentPanel; while(Input.NextPanel(panels2, out currentPanel)) { Input.ShowTextBox("Name", "folder_label"); Out.WriteLine("Type: {0}
", currentPanel.ChildAsset.Type); } //post_input example - if the asset instance you are using to call GetPanelsFromFolder is not the same as the asset you are editing. Asset folder = asset.Parent; string prefix = "folder_" ;// Use a string common to your panel name, idname, and label name. If you used the version were you DID NOT specify your own label name and idname, the panel name should work. Dictionary allContent = folder.GetContent(); foreach(KeyValuePair entry in allContent) { if (entry.Key.StartsWith(prefix)) { folder.DeleteContentField(entry.Key); } } Dictionary toFolder = new Dictionary(); foreach(KeyValuePair entry in context.InputForm) { if (entry.Key.StartsWith(prefix)) { toFolder.Add(entry.Key, entry.Value); } } context.InputForm.Remove(toFolder.Keys); folder.SaveContent(toFolder); %>

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.GetPanelsFromFolder(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset,System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetType,System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.CreateThumbnail(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Img,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Creates a thumbnail of the specified size from the currently loaded image. A ThumbnailKey is required. The resulting image will be stored on the asset unless we are in upload.aspx, in that case it will be saved to the asset or current panel at the time the input form is saved.
To change the currently uploaded image in place use the uploadContext.UploadedFile.UploadKey as the thumbnail Key.

Important note, if calling from upload.aspx and the thumbnail key is not the same as the upload, make sure that the thumbnail key is in the list of strings passed as the hiddenFields parameter of the Input.ShowAcquireImage() call.
Note: Due to memory limitations, the pixel count of the source image cannot be more than 10 million.

member.param: The image to be used to create the thumbnail
The Key used to refer to the thumbnail later as part of the asset's content.
The width.
The height.
Optional: The Quality of the saved JPG as a percent. Higher numbers have higher quality, but also bigger sizes. Defaults to 75.
Optional: Pass false if you want the thumbnail to be generated with exactly the size of the passed in width and height. Defaults to true.
member.returns: An ImgResult.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the current asset instance. It is marked for deletion and purged from the database after 2 weeks. The current user must have permission to delete the asset. The root asset (id == 0), may not be deleted.
member.returns: True if successful, false if nothing is removed. There may be an accompanying error if false is returned, but not if the asset was not loaded.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.SetWorkflow(System.Int32,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Status,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Change the current asset to the workflow specified by the workflowId parameter. Make sure this is a workflow id and not the id of a workflow asset. Use SetWorkflowByAsset to set workflows with a workflow asset. NOTE: You can optionally pass a status, but be careful. By default workflow related tasks such as publishing are not executed. Pass "executeStep:true", if you wish to execute workflow related code such as publishing. If you do not pass true for this parameter and there is a conflict, the conflicting asset will move to the configured conflict state, but no publishing will occur. This method is primarily intended for configuration. Route or Publish may be more approriate if you really want to execute workflow or workflow related code.
member.param: The id of the workflow that you want to change to
Optional: Pass null to keep the asset in the same state, otherwise you will go to the state you provide. Defaults to null.
Optional: Whether or not to execute workflow on the current step when you go to the new workflow. Defaults to false.
member.returns: true if the workflow is changed, false if not

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.SetWorkflowByAsset(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Status,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Change the current asset to the workflow specified by the workflowAsset parameter. NOTE: You can optionally pass a status, but be careful. By default workflow related tasks such as publishing are not executed. Pass "executeStep:true", if you wish to execute workflow related code such as publishing. If you do not pass true for this parameter and there is a conflict, the conflicting asset will move to the configured conflict state, but no publishing will occur. This method is primarily intended for configuration. Route or Publish may be more approriate if you really want to execute workflow or workflow related code.
member.param: This is an asset that represents the workflow that is found in /System/Workflows or in a project specific "Workflows" folder
Optional: Pass null to keep the asset in the same state, otherwise you will go to the state you provide. Defaults to null.
Optional: Whether or not to execute workflow on the current step when you go to the new workflow. Defaults to false.
member.returns: true if the workflow is changed, false if not

member.returns: true if the template is changed, false if not

If you do not pass true for this parameter and there is a conflict, the conflicting asset will move to the configured conflict state, but no publishing will occur. This method is primarily intended for configuration. Route or Publish may be more approriate if you really want to execute workflow or workflow related code.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.Load(System.Int32)

summary.para: Loads the asset by id or an appropriate branch. For example, if you pass the id of an asset that is "RETIRED", and you are publishing to "LIVE", it will look for an asset on the same branch as the asset you were looking for that is in the "LIVE" state.
Use IsLoaded to see if loading was successful.
Note: Use LoadDirect to ignore statuses.
If the asset does not exist in one of the valid states, an appropriate branch may be returned.
Results will depend on the current valid statuses (See context.FilterStatus).

Depending on the use case there will be a list of legal statuses, the returned asset must not only match the provided path, but it must either have one of the valid statuses or have been published to a server with one of the valid statuses or have one of the statuses configured in its current workflow step. If there is more than one match, the asset with the highest id and therefore the one created most-recently is returned.
Valid Statuses:
Preview: All the states checked under System, MyAccount, Preferences in the section title "My Default Browse State(s)", plus "" (No-workflow)
Publishing: The state associated with the current server for the workflow step and "" (no workflow).
View Output: All state(s) associated with all servers configured for the current asset for the current workflow step and "" (no workflow).
All Others Contexts: All states are legal

member.param: The asset id.
member.returns: The asset. IsLoaded will be false if no match was found.
member.exception: If you attempt to load an asset which exists, but is not a file or a folder (such as an FTP mount), it will throw a NotSupportedException.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.Load(System.String)

summary.para: Loads an asset from the specified path - for example "/Site/Folder/Page". Calling Asset.Load("") will load an empty asset without accessing the DB. "cpt_internal" style links - "/cpt_internal/828/856/870" and strings which contain only an asset id "870" are also supported.
Use IsLoaded to see if loading was successful.
Id paths which do not have "/cpt_internal" such as "/828/856/870" are not supported, use Asset.LoadByIdPath() instead.
Results will depend on the current valid statuses (See context.FilterStatus).
Note: Use LoadDirect to ignore statuses.

Depending on the use case there will be a list of legal statuses, the returned asset must not only match the provided path, but it must either have one of the valid statuses or have been published to a server with one of the valid statuses or have one of the statuses configured in its current workflow step. If there is more than one match, the asset with the highest id and therefore the one created most-recently is returned.
If the asset does not exist in one of the valid states, an appropriate branch may be returned.
Results will depend on the current valid statuses (See context.FilterStatus).

Depending on the use case there will be a list of legal statuses, the returned asset must not only match the provided path, but it must either have one of the valid statuses or have been published to a server with one of the valid statuses or have one of the statuses configured in its current workflow step. If there is more than one match, the asset with the highest id and therefore the one created most-recently is returned.
Valid Statuses:
Preview: All the states checked under System, MyAccount, Preferences in the section title "My Default Browse State(s)", plus "" (No-workflow)
Publishing: The state associated with the current server for the workflow step and "" (no workflow).
View Output: All state(s) associated with all servers configured for the current asset for the current workflow step and "" (no workflow).
All Others Contexts: All states are legal

member.param: The path. An empty string will return an unloaded asset. Use "/" to load the root.
member.returns: The asset. IsLoaded will be false if no match was found.

example.code: // Load a folder called "/Site/About Us" Asset otherAsset = Asset.Load("/Site/About us");

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.LoadByIdPath(System.String)

summary.para: Loads the asset specified by the id path which might look like /828/856/870, use Load(string) for "cpt_internal" style. If the asset does not exist in one of the valid states, an appropriate branch may be returned.
Use IsLoaded to see if loading was successful.
Results will depend on the current valid statuses (See context.FilterStatus).

Depending on the use case there will be a list of legal statuses, the returned asset must not only match the provided path, but it must either have one of the valid statuses or have been published to a server with one of the valid statuses or have one of the statuses configured in its current workflow step. If there is more than one match, the asset with the highest id and therefore the one created most-recently is returned.
Valid Statuses:
Preview: All the states checked under System, MyAccount, Preferences in the section title "My Default Browse State(s)", plus "" (No-workflow)
Publishing: The state associated with the current server for the workflow step and "" (no workflow).
View Output: All state(s) associated with all servers configured for the current asset for the current workflow step and "" (no workflow).
All Others Contexts: All states are legal

member.param: The path in Id format
member.returns: The asset. IsLoaded will be false if no match was found.

If there is more than one match, the asset with the highest id and therefore the one created most-recently is returned.
Valid Statuses:

Publishing: The state associated with the current server for the workflow step and "" (no workflow).

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.LoadDirect(System.Int32,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Load an asset with the given asset id, if it exists, regardless of the state or context.
Use IsLoaded to see if loading was successful.
Don't use this if you expect the asset may be branch. It will load assets, that may not be available on the server where you are publishing.

member.param: The id for the asset that you want to return
Optional: Load the asset, even if it has been recently deleted (not yet purged). Defaults to false
member.returns: An asset. IsLoaded will be false if none was found.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.LoadDirect(System.String)

summary.para: Load an asset with the given asset path, if it exists, regardless of the state or context. If there are two or more assets with the same path, the asset with the highest id number (most-recently created) is returned.
Use IsLoaded to see if loading was successful.
Don't use this if you expect the asset to have branches. It will load assets, that may not be available on the server where you are publishing.

member.param: The path to an asset. Like "/Site/MyFolder/MyAsset" or "/cpt_internal/828/856/870". An empty string will return an unloaded asset. Use "/" to load the root.
member.returns: An asset. IsLoaded will be false if none was found.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.LoadDirect(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPath)

summary.para: Load an asset with the given asset path, if it exists, regardless of the state or context. If there are two or more assets with the same path, the asset with the highest id number (most-recently created) is returned.
Use IsLoaded to see if loading was successful.
Don't use this if you expect the asset to have branches. It will load assets, that may not be available on the server where you are publishing.

member.param: The path to an asset. Like new AssetPath("/Site/MyFolder/MyAsset"). Use new AssetPath("/") to load the root.
member.returns: An asset. IsLoaded will be false if none was found.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.GetLink(System.Boolean,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ProtocolType)
member.summary: Renders a link to the asset based on the current context. Upon publishing, it will return the link to the published page. Upon previewing, it will return the cms preview link to the page. Defaults to LinkType.Default for the link type. Defaults to "output" for the layout. If this is a preview and a preview template exists, it will use that for a default.
member.param: Optional: If true add HostName for current publishing package to link. Defaults to false. Must be in OutputContext (output template or filename or url template) and publishing. No effect in Preview.
Optional: If addDomain is true, determines if the protocol should be added and whether to use http or https. No effect in Preview.indexer Defaults to http.
member.returns: The link to the asset

example.code:
<% Asset boardAsset = Asset.Load("/Site/About Us/Board of Directors"); %> <%= boardAsset.Label %>
/// <% Asset boardAsset = Asset.Load("/Site/About Us/Board of Directors"); %> <%= boardAsset.Label %>

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.GetLink(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.LinkType,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ProtocolType)
member.summary: Renders a link to the asset based upon the current context. Upon publishing, it will return the link to the published page. Upon previewing, it will return the cms preview link to the page.
member.param: The link type.
Optional: The layout name, without file extension. Default is "output". If this is a preview and a preview template exists, it will use that for a default.
Optional: args such as _pagenum=2
Optional: If true add HostName for current publishing package to link. Defaults to false. Must be in OutputContext (output template or filename or url template) and publishing.
Optional: If addDomain is true, determines if the protocol should be added and whether to use http or https.indexer. Defaults to http.
member.returns: A link to the page.
member.example: Link to Home Page <% Asset homePageAsset = Asset.Load("/Site/Home Page/Index"); %> <%= homePageAsset["short_title"]%> Link to XML feed of the Home Page <% Asset homePageAsset = Asset.Load("/Site/Home Page/Index"); %> "><%= homePageAsset["xml_link_text"] %> Include link to the home page CSS file. <% Asset styleSheetAsset = Asset.Load("/Assets/Css/Home Page") %>

member.param: Optional: If true add HostName for current publishing package to link. Defaults to false.
Optional: If addDomain is true, determines if the protocol should be added and whether to use http or https.indexer. Defaults to http.
member.returns: the last published link(s) of the asset or the binary file

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.GetContentFields(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})

summary.para: Gets a dictionary of fields dependending on the fieldNames argument.
This function is called on the current asset for all templates before running to load all DB fields.
Will look for both fields equaling the name and equaling "upload#" plus the name unless the specified name already starts with upload#.
If you don't provide this param, or pass null, or pass an empty list or pass a list that contains a * element, then all fields in the db are returned.

Found fields are added to this asset instance's cache so there will be no more DB hits when you access them. If the optional to load all fields is taken, then any other fields lookups on the asset instance will not go back to the DB

member.param: Optional: Specifies the fields to return. Defaults to null.
member.returns: An interface into a dictionary holding key value pairs of the data that the method was able to retrieve

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.GetMeta
member.summary: Returns the meta data in a Dictionary.
member.returns: A dictionary containing all of this asset's meta data.

example.code: Dictionary<string, string> metaData = asset.GetMeta(); asset.SaveMeta(metaData);

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.GetContent
member.summary: Gets the content fields and caches them in this asset's indexer, then returns them in a Dictionary.
member.returns: A dictionary containing all of this asset's fields.

example.code: Dictionary<string, string> theContent = asset.GetContent(); asset.SaveContent(anotherAsset.GetContent());

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.Item(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets or sets the with the specified key. Setting a value is not permanent unless SaveContent is called with no arguments. Data is set in memory. Assigning a value using [] on the implicit "asset" which is always available can be used to pass data from new.aspx to input.aspx and from post_input.aspx to post_save.aspx.
If assigning a value of null, it will be stored as an empty string
member.param: The field name

remarks.para: This indexer does not save set fields to the database automatically. To do so, use Asset.SaveContent or Asset.SaveContentField.
Values retrieved with this indexer are cached. If you have two objects referring to the same CMS asset and only update one of them, the other will retain the old values.

If the value is null, it will be stored as an empty string
member.param: The key.
The value.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.SaveContentField(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Saves a content field to the database.
If the value is null, it will be stored as an empty string
member.param: The key.
The value.
member.remarks: The asset's indexer will also be updated.

member.remarks: Variations on the key such as upload fields and arrays are NOT removed unless specifically named by the key.

member.summary: Delete all the content fields whose names are in the given list

member.summary: Deletes a meta data field with the given key.
member.param: The key or name of the field.
member.returns: The old value

example.code: <% string oldValue = asset.DeleteMetaField("my_field"); %>

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.DeleteMetaFields(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Delete all the meta data fields whose names are in the given list
member.param: List of names of the meta data fields to remove.
member.returns: A Dictionary containing the old values of the removed meta data fields

example.code: List<string> deleteFields = new List<string>() { "description", "title", "category", "keywords" }; Dictionary<string, string> deletedFields = asset.DeleteMetaFields(deleteFields);

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.SaveMeta(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Saves either the asset's indexer or the meta data fields provided in a dictionary to the database as this asset's meta data fields.
If any of the values in the fieldsToStore dictionary are null, they will be stored as an empty string.
member.param: Optional: If not null, the fields to store. Otherwise the asset's indexer dictionary will be saved.
member.remarks: If is specified, the asset's Meta indexer dictionary will be updated as well.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.SaveContent(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Saves either the asset's indexer or the content provided in a dictionary to the database as this asset's fields.
If any of the values in the fieldsToStore dictionary are null, they will be stored as an empty string.
member.param: Optional: If not null, the fields to store. Otherwise the asset's indexer dictionary will be saved.
member.remarks: If is specified, the asset's indexer dictionary will be updated as well.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.AddDependencyTo(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset)
member.summary: Adds a dependency on this asset to the provided asset. So when this asset publishes, it will check the asset or its children and see if they need to be published.
member.param: The dependent asset which will be the child.

example.code:
<%
            
            
              // If a new child is added to the Press Releases folder and published, publish the Index
            
              Asset dependentAsset = Asset.Load("/Site/Press Releases/");
              Asset indexAsset = Asset.Load("/Site/Index");
              indexAsset.AddDependencyTo(dependentAsset);
            
            
             %>

The EmailAttachement that will be saved intot he asset.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.SaveUploadedFile(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.UploadedFile)

summary.para: Save an uploaded file to an asset. Usually used in upload.aspx to save the original image before creating a thumbnail.

Import Note: This would be called from upload.aspx when using Input.ShowAcquireImage() to upload an image. You need to provide this key to the ShowAcquireImage call in the optional "hiddenFields" parameter, otherwise things may not save correctly.
When calling from upload.aspx, saving is not immediate. Data is stored temporarily and is saved when the form is committed.

member.param: The name to save it under. Don't include "upload#". If null or an empty string is passed, we will use the key in the object
The uploaded file.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.SaveAssetAsAttachment(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Used to save an uploaded asset's file contents to another asset as an attachment. Attachment names are automatically generated except for the extension. This extension is derived from the asset label. Everything after the last dot (if any) is included in the extension. Extensions are sanitized to remove commas and other problematic symbols. Attachments do not currently support non ASCII characters and so if the extension is in a non-ASCII language, the extension may become mangled.
member.param: The name to save it under. Don't include "upload#". If null or an empty string is passed, we will use the key in the object
The asset. Must have been created via upload.
If true will be setup as a "binary link field"

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.Route(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Status,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Route the given asset to a workflow step that corresponds to the given status. The asset must have workflow. The status must correspond to one of the steps on the asset's current workflow. If more than one workflow step has the given state, then the lowest step will be chosen. Use Status.Load(string statusName) to load the status. If it returns false, check the context.Error property. Currently, you may only route file assets, routing folders in not supported.
member.param: The status.
Optional: Applies only when workflow results in a publish. If true, dependencies will be computed and published if necessary. Defaults to false.
member.returns: true if successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.Publish(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Publish the asset. If we are in a session, it will reuse the same session, otherwise a new session is created. Only files are currently supported.
member.param: Optional: pass true to include dependencies. Defaults to false
Optional: publishing arguments like _pageNum=1. Defaults to empty string.
member.returns: true if successful. If false, check the context.Error for the error message

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset.Show(System.String)
member.summary: Similar to include but instead evaluates another asset preview/output within its own context as opposed to the current asset context. This is often used to combine different templates to create a composite template.
member.param: Optional: Name of output template file to render. Defaults to "output".
member.returns: Render output

example.code:
<% Asset navAsset = Asset.Load(asset["nav_id"]); %> <% string featureOutput = Asset.Load(asset["feature_id"]).Show(); %>
<%= asset.Show("stage_output") %>
<%= navAsset.Show() %> <%= featureStageOutput %>
<%= Asset.Load("/Footer.html").Show() %>

member.summary: Generates the output for each layout within a template.
member.param: The current asset
If the layout is not specified then this field is used to discover the name of the layout within the current asset's content
A dictionary where each key value pair consists of the name of the column and the content (markup) that should be placed within the column

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.IsPublishing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the currently running template file is part of a publishing process.
member.value: true if this instance is publishing; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.LayoutName
member.summary: Name of the layout file such as output.aspx or xml_output.aspx.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.PublishingStatus
member.summary: The status that corresponds to the current publishing destination.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.PublishingPackage
member.summary: The destination package.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.PageNumber
member.summary: The current page number for a paginated asset. Will be zero for non-paginated assets.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.PublishingArgs
member.summary: Gets the publishing args. Use HasArgs property to see if args are available. Use dictionary notation [] to access specific values.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.PublishAgain
member.summary: Use to cause the publish loop to run one more time. Use PublishingLoopNumber to see which iteration you are currently on. The limit is 100 iterations. This is independent of pagination when using Util.Paginate() in that case the publishing loop will continue for the necessary number of pages and this property will be false.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.PublishingLoopNumber
member.summary: The current publishing loop number. Usually the same as page number, but it always starts at 1. Goes hand-in-hand with "PublishAgain". Use this to see which iteration you are on if you are using PublishAgain to continue publishing.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.KeepPublishingPaginate
member.summary: Used by Util.Paginate() to keep publishing loop running.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.KeepPublishingPaginateMaxCount
member.summary: Used by Util.Paginate() to store the number of pages.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.SelfReferencingLinkTable
member.summary: Used by publisher to make sure that pages generated by currently published asset can be enqueud and published right away before the dependencies

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.RemotePath
member.summary: The path of the published file on the server Readonly: Setting context.PublishPath in filename.aspx or assetfilename.aspx can be used to change the value of the file path. Publishing Properties can also be set for this purpose.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.LocalPath
member.summary: The path of the published file on the CMS Readonly: asset.Move() and/or asset.Rename() can be used to change the path.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.RelativeFolder
member.summary: The path to the folder that contains the asset relative to where the asset's deployment properties are found. For example, if an asset is in /Site/About Us and it's deployment properties are on the Site folder, the value would be "About Us".

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.PropertiesExtension
member.summary: Extension extracted from the filename on the publishing properties page

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.PropertiesFilename
member.summary: The filename on the publishing properties page

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.PropertiesFolder
member.summary: The folder from the Publishing properties page

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.RemoteHostname
member.summary: FTP Hostname where the file is being published

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.RemoteUsername
member.summary: Username used to connect to the remote FTP host.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.PublishUrl
member.summary: Current value of the publish URL (relative). It can be overridden in url.aspx or asseturl.aspx. The URL is used to generate links to an asset or other resource. PublishUrl must sometimes may generated independently of the filename depending on how the server is setup. WARNING: This value is not populated and has no effect in filename.aspx and assetfilename.aspx

example.code: // overriding the publish url in url.aspx context.PublishUrl = context.PublishUrl + context.PageNumber + ".html";

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.PublishPath
member.summary: Current value of the publish Path (the ftp filename relative to the root). Used in the actual transfer of a file to the server. It can be overridden in filename.aspx or assetfilename.aspx. WARNING: This value is not populated and has no effect in url.aspx and asseturl.aspx

example.code: // overriding the publish path in filename.aspx context.PublishPath = context.PublishPath + context.PageNumber + ".html";

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.RenderPublishLinks
member.summary: Set this to true, if you want generated links to be publish links during preview.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.IsGeneratingPublishLinks
member.summary: Whether or not asset.getLink will give a live link or a preview. True if RenderPublishLinks or IsPublishing is true. Preview defaults to false. While publishing or running View Output, defaults to true.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.IsGeneratingDependencies
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to generate dependencies (will also disable manual dependencies). Defaults to true.
member.value: true if true generate dependencies; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.DisableAutoDependencyGeneration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to automatically generate dependencies. Use in conjuction with Asset.AddDependencyTo to manually control dependency links. Defaults to false.
member.value: true if true, disables automatic dependency generation; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.OutputContext.DisablePreviewCache
member.summary: Set this to true if you want to disable the preview render cache for this asset. Does not affect publishing. It is recommended you keep the default value of false.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.InputContext.ShowSaveNewButton
member.summary: Setting this value to true will activate and display the "Save and New" button. Clicking the "Save and New" button saves the current asset and creates a new one. The newly created asset will inherit the fields from the other asset. Loads the newly created assset in Edit mode.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.InputContext.ShowSaveEditButton
member.summary: Setting this value to true will activate and display the "Save and Edit" button. Clicking the "Save and Edit" button saves the current changes to the database and keeps the form open so edits can continue to be made.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.InputContext.ShowPublishButton
member.summary: Setting this value to true will show the "Publish" button. Clicking this button will publish the asset. ShowPublishButton defaults to true.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.InputContext.ShowSavePreview
member.summary: Setting this value to true will show the "Save & Preview" button. Clicking the "Save & Preview" button saves the current changes and renders the preview of the asset. ShowSavePreview defaults to true.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Context.ExecutedById
member.summary: The asset id of the asset that is executing this template. Only populated if the current template is called by another such as when using an Asset.Show() or Asset.GetLink() command. Calling template must also be a C# template.
member.value: The asset id of the calling asset, if set. Otherwise it will be null. Use context.ExecutedById.HasValue to check.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Context.PreviewVersionId
member.summary: If present, the asset's content will come from this previous version

summary.para: Contains the names of statuses like "Live" and "Stage" which are considered valid in the current context. There is usually always a blank "" which signifies that assets without workflow are valid.
Affects all calls which use filter status including Asset.Load(), Asset.GetFilterList(), Asset.GetFileList(), and Asset.GetFolderList() unless specifically set by those functions.
This is a ReadOnlyCollection. You may read it, but not modify it. Reading this type of collection is almost identical to reading a List.

If this is set, then when asset objects are looking for fields via the [] operator, they will first look for the the culture string (fr for example) plus name before returning, otherwise the field without the string will be returned.
This will remain set for the lifetime of the currently running template unless specifically set to another culture or to null which will restore the default.
The default culture has a string of "en-US"

Use InputForm to read and manipulate data that will be saved to the current asset. It will be populated by the data posted from the input form (input.aspx), but you can change, add, or remove values.

member.summary: If there was an error while loading this image a message will be here. Check HasError to see if an error happened

member.summary: USe to check if there was an error while loading. Use ErrorMessage to see a description.
member.value: true if this instance has load error; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Img.CreateThumbnail(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Creates a thumbnail of the specified size from the currently loaded image. A ThumbnailKey is required. The resulting image will be in memory. Use Asset.CreateThumbnail, PanelEntry.CreateThumbnail, or ImageForm.CreateThumbnail to preserve the data.
Note: Due to memory limitations, the pixel count of the source image cannot be more than 10 million.

member.param: The Key used to refer to the thumbnail later as part of the asset's content.
The width.
The height.
Optional: The Quality of the saved JPG as a percent. Higher numbers have higher quality, but also bigger sizes.
Optional: Pass false if you want the thumbnail to be generated with exactly the size of the passed in width and height.
member.returns: An ImgResult

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Img.CropImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Crop a an image out of the original (current instance) using the coordinate defined by x,y,xx,yy, then scale it using width and height as in the CreateThumbnail call. The final image dimensions will not necessarily match the width and height unless the aspect ratio is preserved.
member.param: The width used to scale the final image.
The height used to scale the final image.
The first x-coordinate (left) in pixels for the box used to cut out the cropped image.
The first y-coordinate (top) in pixels for the box used to cut out the cropped image.
The width in pixels for the box used to cut out the cropped image.
The height in pixels for the box used to cut out the cropped image.
Optional: The quality of the resulting image as a percent. Defaults to 75
member.returns: ImgResult. Contains the new Img. Use HasError to check for errors.

member.param: The asset.
member.returns: The Img object.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.ShowFormSelector(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a dropdown that will show the controls associated with the currently selected value, while hiding those that are not. All controls are rendered the first time the corresponding dropdown option is selected. Supports nesting, so calling ShowFormSelector within a form will work as expected.
member.param: The label.
The field name where the selected dropdown value will be stored.
A dictionary representing the rows that will appear in the drop down. The key is the display label and the value is the path to the form.
Optional: The desired default form. Setting this field will set the dropdown to this value if nothing has been previously selected.

Optional: Creates a row in the dropdown menu with the given value, but does not associate it with a set of controls to show and hide. Selecting this value will hide all controls on the resulting form.

example.code: Dictionary<string, string> forms = new Dictionary<string, string>() {{"form one label", "path/to/form/one.aspx" }, { "form two Label", "path/to/form/two.aspx" }}; Input.ShowFormSelector("Form Selector", "form_selector", forms, defaultValue: "path/to/form/one.aspx", firstRowLabel: "none");

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.StartDropDownContainer(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a dropdown that will show the controls associated with the currently selected value, while hiding those that are not. All controls that fall under the StartDropDownContainer will correspond to the first item in the rows dictionary. Supports nesting, so calling StartDropDownContainer within another DropDownConntainer will work as expected.
member.param: The label.
The field name where the selected dropdown value will be stored.
A dictionary representing the rows that will appear in the drop down. The key is the display label and the value is the html value attribute.
Optional: The desired default value. Setting this field will set the dropdown to this value if nothing has been previously selected.

Optional: Creates a row in the dropdown menu with the given value, but does not associate it with a set of controls to show and hide. Selecting this value will hide all controls on the resulting form.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.NextDropDownContainer
member.summary: Advances the DropDownContainer to the next row. Will throw an error if called before calling StartDropDownContainer. Will throw an error if NextDropDownContainer is called more times than there items in the dictionary passed to StartDropDownContainer.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.EndDropDownContainer
member.summary: Closes the drop down container. Will throw an error if called without first calling StartDropDownContainer.

member.summary: Displays a "select" and "clear" button that is used to select a folder. Note: Before build 2481, there is a default value for the third argument of the overloaded version of this method. So until build 2481 and higher is available, you will need to pass a third argument to this function.
member.param: The label.
Name of the field.
Optional: If none is specified, it will default to the root folder.

Optional: The popup help message.

example.code: [ <% Input.ShowSelectFolder("Folder", "selected_folder"); %> <% Input.ShowSelectFolder("Folder", "selected_folder2", "/Assets/Images"); %> <% Input.ShowSelectFolder("Folder with Help", "selected_folder3", helpMessage: "Help Message"); %>

member.summary: Displays a "select" and "clear" button that is used to upload a document into the current template.

Customization parameters.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.ShowAcquireImage(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a "select" and "clear" button that is used to upload an image into the current template.
member.param: The label of the field when displayed.
The field name where the uploaded filename will be stored.
Optional: help message

example.code:

             Input.ShowAcquireImage("Attachment", "attach", "This is the help message." );

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.ShowAcquireImage(System.String,System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a "select" and "clear" button that is used to upload an image into the current template. Note: You no longer need to use an upload.aspx, if you want to create a thumbnail. Use the AddAdditionalImage method on the ShowAcquireParams object to define the thumbnails that you want to create. See the examples below.
member.param: The label of the field when displayed.
The field name where the uploaded filename will be stored.
Customization parameters. An empty "Extensions" parameter will default to: "png gif jpeg jpg"
Optional: help message
Optional: If you are passing a list of thumbnails to create in the ShowAcquireParams, use it to specify which one to display.
Optional: The popup help message.

example.code:
<%  
                                 // Upload or select an image and create images of the specified sizes.  
                                 // The 300 size will be displayed on the input form
                                 ShowAcquireParams parameters = new ShowAcquireParams();  
                                 parameters.DefaultFolder ="/Assets/images";
                                 // Create a thumbnail that is no more than 300 pixels on each side (aspect ratio is preserved)
                                 parameters.AddAdditionalImage("my_photo_300", 300, 300);
                                 // Create a thumbnail that is no more than 100 pixels on each side (aspect ratio is preserved)
                                 parameters.AddAdditionalImage("my_photo_100", 100, 100, 100);    
                                 // The 300 pixel thumbnail will be displayed when they edit this input form.
                                 Input.ShowAcquireImage("Attachment", "attach", parameters, displaySizeName: "my_photo_300") ;
                              %>
                              <% 
                                 // Upload only
                                 // The 300 size will be displayed on the input form
                                 ShowAcquireParams parameters = new ShowAcquireParams();  
                                 parameters.DefaultFolder ="/Assets/images";
                                 parameters.ShowBrowse = false; // CMS browser is hidden
                                 parameters.AddAdditionalImage("my_photo_300", 300, 300);
                                 parameters.AddAdditionalImage("my_photo_100", 100, 100, 100);    
                                 Input.ShowAcquireImage("Attachment", "attach", parameters, displaySizeName: "my_photo_300") ;
                              %>

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.ShowWysiwyg(System.String,System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.ShowPassword(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a password textbox control to the input screen. This features is provided as a convenience for developers. CrownPeak will not be responsible for the security of this password. Template developers will be responsible for handling the security of passwords submitted with this type of text box. Passwords can be handled in the post input template. They can be encrypted before storing or used and cleared depending on the usage. If they are not handled in the post_input, they will be stored in clear text in the asset content properties.
member.param: The label of the field when displayed.
The field name where the value will be stored.
The # of characters defining the width of the TextBox.

Optional: adds the maxlength attibute.
Optional: help message
Optional: The popup help message.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.ShowSelectDateTime(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shows a date and time selector control. Dates and times are stored in the format "MM/dd/yyy HH:mm:ss" (24-hour time).
member.param: The label of the field when displayed.
The field name where the value will be stored.
Optional: defaults to false. If true, converts from user time to UTC on save (and converts from UTC on re-edit) for parity with VB's showSelectGMT.
Optional: defaults to false. If true, the hour dropdown is 00-23 instead of 01-12 and an am/pm dropdown.
Optional: defaults to false. Make the text box read only.
Optional: help message
Optional: The popup help message.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.ShowDragDrop(System.String,System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.DragParams,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shows a container for drag and drop components (V3 only).

Optional: The popup help message.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.ShowDropDown(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shows a drop down menu selector control.
member.param: The label of the field when displayed.
The field name where the value will be stored.
The text list. A comma-separated list of strings to display in the drop down. Use the other version if a comma is in the list.
The value list. A comma-separated list of strings to store when values are selected from drop down. Use the other version if a comma is in the list.

Optional: defaults to null. The list of default values that will appear selected when nothing has been selected. The size of this list can only be greater than 1 if and only if the optional parameter multiple is set to true.
Optional: defaults to 1. This optional parameter sets the size parameter of the select tag.
Optional: defaults to false. Setting this optional parameter to true will allow multiple selections from the drop down menu.
Optional: help message
Optional: The popup help message.

example.code: // The users will see Zero, One, and Two, but 0,1,2 will be stored as the value Input.ShowDropDown("Nested Drop Down", "nested_drop", "Zero,One,Two", "0,1,2");

//The users will see English, French, Japanese, and Korean, but en, fr, jp, kr as the value Input.ShowDropDown("Language Settings", "language_setting", "English,French,Japanese,Korean", "en,fr,jp,kr", Util.MakeList("en"), 4, true);

The field name where the value will be stored.
A list of key/value pairs that define the entries in the list. Key is the text that is displayed, value gets stored.

Optional: defaults to 1. This optional parameter sets the size parameter of the select tag.
Optional: defaults to false. Setting this optional parameter to true will allow multiple selections from the drop down menu.
Optional: help message
Optional: The popup help message.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Input.NextPanel(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ListPanelType,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},CrownPeak.CMSAPI.SortOrder,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the next available panel from the named list. Always returns at least one entry. Uses data already stored in the asset.
member.param: Name of the list of panels. Must not be the same as any other list names or field names unless isAutoIndexed is false.
Type of list to display. Default is ListPanelType.Regular
Optional: Minimum number of panels (but always at least one). Default is null
Optional: Maximum number of panels. Default is null
Optional: Sort order used for the sorted list type. Must be specified if and only if the type is ListPanelType.Sorted
Optional: Name to display for the list panel. Not applicable in Classic. Default is null
Optional: Whether the panel handles the list index field automatically. In most cases this should be true, unless another field in the list has the same name as the list. Default is true
member.returns: Whether there is an available panel.

Optional: Minimum number of panels (but always at least one). Default is null
Optional: Maximum number of panels. Default is null
Optional: Sort order used for the sorted list type. Must be specified if and only if the type is ListPanelType.Sorted
Optional: Name to display for the list panel. Not applicable in Classic. Default is null
Optional: Whether the panel handles the list index field automatically. In most cases this should be true, unless another field in the list has the same name as the list. Default is true
member.returns: Whether there is an available panel.

member.name: T:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ExecuteWorkflowCommandResponse
member.summary: Returned by some calls to encapsulate the result of the operation.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ExecuteWorkflowCommandResponse.FailedAssets
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of failed assets.
member.value: List of failed assets if not using a long running task, otherwise an empty list

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ExecuteWorkflowCommandResponse.IsLongRunning
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this ExecuteWorkflowCommand request used a long running task.
member.value: true if this ExecuteWorkflowCommand request used a long running task; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ExecuteWorkflowCommandResponse.JobId
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the long running Job Id if this request used a long running task.
member.value: value of the long running Job Id if this request used a long running task, otherwise zero.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ExecuteWorkflowCommandResponse.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the error message.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ExecuteWorkflowCommandResponse.HasError
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance has error.
member.value: true if this instance has error; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams
member.summary: Parameters to be used in Asset.GetFilterList.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a filter on a field to be compared as an .
member.param: The name of the field to compare.
The comparison operator.
The value.
Optional: Set to true if the field might be stored in an array (on a repeating panel).

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add("foo", Comparison.Equals, 42);

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a filter on a property to be compared as an .
member.param: The name of the asset property to compare.
The comparison operator.
The value.

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add(AssetPropertyNames.Id, Comparison.Equals, 42);

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a filter on a field to be compared as a . Fields can be filtered as dates if they are between January 1, 1753, through December 31, 9999. This is a limitation of the database. It does not have the range of the DateTime data type in C#.
member.param: The name of the field to compare.
The comparison operator.
The value.
Optional: Set to true if the field might be stored in an array (on a repeating panel).

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add("foo", Comparison.Equals, new DateTime(2010, 11, 15));

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Adds a filter on a property to be compared as a .
member.param: The name of the asset property to compare.
The comparison operator.
The value.

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add(AssetPropertyNames.LastModified, Comparison.GreaterThan, new DateTime(2010, 11, 15));

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a filter on a field to be compared as a .
member.param: The name of the field to compare.
The comparison operator.
The value.
Optional: Set to true if the field might be stored in an array (on a repeating panel).

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add("foo", Comparison.Equals, true);

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a filter on a property to be compared as a .
member.param: The name of the asset property to compare.
The comparison operator.
The value.

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add(AssetPropertyNames.SomeBool, Comparison.Equals, true);

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a filter on a field to be compared as a .
member.param: The name of the field to compare.
The comparison operator.
The value.
Optional: Set to true if the field might be stored in an array (on a repeating panel).

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add("foo", Comparison.Equals, "bar");

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a filter on a property to be compared as a .
member.param: The name of the asset property to compare.
The comparison operator.
The value.

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add(AssetPropertyNames.Label, Comparison.Equals, "foo");

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetType)
member.summary: Adds a filter on a property for comparing asset type.
member.param: The operator to compare with. Such as GreaterThan or LessThan.
The type of the asset to compare.

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add(Comparison.Equals, AssetType.File);

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a filter on a field to be compared as a . Fields can be filtered as floats if they are a number in the range - 1.79E+308 to -2.23E-308, 0 and 2.23E-308 to 1.79E+308 . This is a limitation of the database storage. It does not have the range of a double in C#.
member.param: The name of the field to compare.
The comparison operator.
The value.
Optional: Set to true if the field might be stored in an array (on a repeating panel).

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add("foo", Comparison.GreaterOrEquals, 12.34);

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.Double)
member.summary: Adds a filter on a property to be compared as a .
member.param: The name of the asset property to compare.
The comparison operator.
The value.

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add(AssetPropertyNames.Label, Comparison.GreaterOrEquals, 12.34);

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a filter which checks a list for the presence of a field.
member.param: The name of the field to compare.
The comparison operator. Must be IsInSet or NotInSet.
The set.
Optional: Set to true if the field might be stored in an array (on a repeating panel).

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add("foo", Comparison.IsInSet, Util.MakeList("value1", "value2"));

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Adds a filter which checks a list for the presence of a property.
member.param: The name of the asset property to compare.
The comparison operator. Must be IsInSet or NotInSet.
The set.

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add(AssetPropertyNames.Label, Comparison.IsInSet, Util.MakeList("value1", "value2"));

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a filter which checks a list for the presence of a field.
member.param: The name of the field to compare.
The comparison operator. Must be IsInSet or NotInSet.
The set.
Optional: Set to true if the field might be stored in an array (on a repeating panel).

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add("foo", Comparison.IsInSet, Util.MakeList(1234, 2345));

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterParams.Add(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Adds a filter which checks a list for the presence of a property.
member.param: The name of the asset property to compare.

example.code: FilterParams filter = new FilterParams(); filter.Add(AssetPropertyNames.Id, Comparison.IsInSet, Util.MakeList(1234, 2345));

member.name: T:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison
member.summary: An enumeration representing operations that can be used in .

member.summary: > operator

member.summary: >= operator

member.summary: < operator

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.LessOrEquals
member.summary: <= operator

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.Equals
member.summary: == operator

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.NotEquals
member.summary: != operator. Note for custom fields this only matches assets where the named field exists.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.NullOrNotEquals
member.summary: == null or != value

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.NotNull
member.summary: != null

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.IsNull
member.summary: == null

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.IsInSet
member.summary: Is in set

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.NotInSet
member.summary: Is not in set. Note for custom fields this only matches assets where the named field exists.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.NullOrNotInSet
member.summary: Is null or not in set

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.StartsWith
member.summary: Starts with. Only valid on strings.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.EndsWith
member.summary: Ends with. Only valid on strings.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Comparison.Contains
member.summary: Contains. Only valid on strings.

member.name: T:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames
member.summary: An enumeration representing the names of properties of the class. Can be used in .

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.WorkflowId
member.summary: The WorkflowId of the asset

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.CreateDate
member.summary: The DateTime the asset was created

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.ModifiedDate
member.summary: The DateTime the asset was modified

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.ChangeDate
member.summary: The DateTime the asset was changed

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.CheckoutDate
member.summary: The DateTime the asset was checkedout

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.TemplateLabel
member.summary: The "Label" (Not full path) of the folder which is assigned as a template. This can be used for filtering, but not sorting.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.CreatedFromModelId
member.summary: This is the id of the model asset used to create this one.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.ModelId
member.summary: The id of the model that is assigned to the asset. For folders. This is the id of a folder whose children show up in the "New" menu when this folder is selected. This can be used for filtering, but not sorting.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.ShortcutId
member.summary: The shortcut id. Usually the same as the id, but different if the asset is a shortcut that points to another.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.BranchId
member.summary: The branch id. Usually the same as the id, but different if the asset is a branch of another asset. This can be used for filtering, but not sorting.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.PublishDate
member.summary: The DateTime the asset was published

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.IsHidden
member.summary: A flag which shows if the asset was hidden

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.IsDeleted
member.summary: A flag which shows the asset has been deleted, but not yet purged (Takes 2 weeks)

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.Type
member.summary: The asset type (File or Folder) . Use FilterParams.Add(Comparison comparisonOperator, AssetType type) to filter on this.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPropertyNames.StatusDate
member.summary: The Date and Time the asset moved into it's current workflow step.

member.name: T:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterTextType
member.summary: Types of text filters that can be used in

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterTextType.Unspecified
member.summary: For serialization only. Don't use.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterTextType.Alpha
member.summary: Filters everything but letters.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterTextType.AlphaNumeric
member.summary: Filters everything but letters and digits.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterTextType.Filename
member.summary: Filters everything not allowed in a file name.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterTextType.Filepath
member.summary: Filters everything not allowed in a file path.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FilterTextType.Numeric
member.summary: Filters everthing but digits.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FolderType.Unspecified
member.summary: For serialization only. Don't use.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FolderType.Folder
member.summary: A regular folder. Not a special type

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FolderType.SiteRoot
member.summary: The root of a webbsite. Usually contains file that publish to the root folder of the website. Used to help locate current project.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FolderType.Project
member.summary: A project. Contains templates and optionally a local library or references to a library.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FolderType.Library
member.summary: A library which is local to the current project

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FolderType.LibraryReference
member.summary: A library which is reference from somewhere else.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FolderType.TemplateFolder
member.summary: A folder that can contain only templates and other template folders. It can only be created in a project or another template folder.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FolderType.Template
member.summary: A folder that contains or can contain template files. It can only be created in a template folder.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FolderType.ModelFolder
member.summary: A folder that contains models.

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FolderType.WorkflowFolder
member.summary: A folder that holds workflows

member.name: F:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FolderType.ComponentFrameworkFolder
member.summary: A folder that holds component library definition assets.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.InputForm.CreateThumbnail(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Img,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Creates a thumbnail of the specified size from the currently loaded image. A ThumbnailKey is required. The resulting image will be stored on the asset at the end of post_input.
Note: Due to memory limitations, the pixel count of the source image cannot be more than 10 million.

member.param: The image to be used to create the thumbnail
The Key used to refer to the thumbnail later as part of the asset's content.
The width.
The height.
Optional: The Quality of the saved JPG as a percent. Higher numbers have higher quality, but also bigger sizes.
Optional: Pass false if you want the thumbnail to be generated with exactly the size of the passed in width and height.Available in builds 3451 and up.
member.returns: An ImgResult.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.InputForm.CreateThumbnail(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.UploadedFile,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Creates a thumbnail of the specified size from an uploaded files. A ThumbnailKey is required. The resulting image will be stored on the asset at the end of post_input.
Note: Due to memory limitations, the pixel count of the source image cannot be more than 10 million.

member.param: The image to be used to create the thumbnail
The Key used to refer to the thumbnail later as part of the asset's content.
The width.
The height.
Optional: The Quality of the saved JPG as a percent. Higher numbers have higher quality, but also bigger sizes.
Optional: Pass false if you want the thumbnail to be generated with exactly the size of the passed in width and height.Available in builds 3451 and up.

member.summary: Recommended Version: Crop the current image stored on the uploadedFile using the box defined on the input form using the lasso. "Lasso" properties must be set on ShowAcquireParams when they are passed to Input.ShowAcquireImage
member.param: UploadedFile that contains an Image
A key used to save the result
Optional: The quality of the resulting image as a percent. Defaults to 75
member.returns: ImgResult. Contains the new Img. Use HasError to check for errors.

A key used to save the result
An object that defines the various lasso params such as BoxWidth and ScaleHeight.
Optional: The quality of the resulting image as a percent. Defaults to 75
