member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the default parameters.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.DefaultFolder
member.summary: Use this parameter to set the default CMS folder that you will see when browsing assets. ShowBrowse must be set to RelationshipType.Link or RelationshipType.Attach.
member.value: A string that represents a CMS folder path like "/Site/About Us"

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.ShowUpload
member.summary: Show the option to upload. Defaults to true

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.ShowBrowse
member.summary: Show the CMS browse view in the acquire dialog. Defaults to true

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.UploadType
member.summary: Optional: Changing this setting is not recommended. Use ShowUpload to control whether the upload control that lets you upload a file will be displayed when you call one of the ShowAcquire methods. Set to RelationshipType.Attach or RelationshipType.Link, if you want to be able to upload files with the control. Attach is recommended. Link will cause a new asset to be created.
member.value: A RelationshipType param. Default is RelationshipType.Attach

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.ModelId
member.summary: Optional: Sets the model id for the file (image or document) to be uploaded. Used only when UploadType = RelationshipType.Link.
member.value: The model id to be used for the new asset.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.BrowseType
member.summary: Optional: Changing this setting is not recommended. Use ShowBrowse to control whether the browse control that lets you select an asset in the CMS will be displayed when you call one of the ShowAcquire methods. Set to RelationshipType.Link or RelationshipType.Attach, if you want to be able to browse for CMS assets with the control. Link is recommended. Attached will cause the selected asset to be copied as an attachment to the current asset.
member.value: A RelationshipType param. Default is RelationshipType.Link

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.PickerType
member.summary: Set to PickerView.FileView, PickerView.DigitalAssetView or PickerView.CollectionView, if you want to change the default view for the picker when browsing the CMS assets. If DAM and/or Collections are not enabled on the instance the FileView option will be used.
member.value: A PickerView param. Default is PickerView.FileView

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.ShowLasso
member.summary: Set this to true if you want the "lasso" selector to show up when you upload an image to the Input.ShowAcquireImage() control. This gives you a draggable and resizable rectangle that can be used to select a region to "crop" from the image. Call InputForm.CropImage in post_input.aspx to use the last selected "lasso" parameters to crop the image.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.LassoHeight
member.summary: Optional: Y-component of lasso aspect ratio. Works with Lasso. When calling InputForm.CropImage() in post_input, scales cropped image using this value. 0 or less for this value will result will result in no scaling for this dimension.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.LassoWidth
member.summary: Optional: X-component of lasso aspect ratio. Works with Lasso. When calling InputForm.CropImage() in post_input, scales cropped image using this value. 0 or less for this value will result will result in no scaling for this dimension.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.LassoBoxTop
member.summary: Optional: The initial top pixel postion of the "lasso" crop-selector when you have uploaded an image and want to crop it. ShowLasso must be set to true. If InputForm.CropImage is called from post_input.aspx, this value will be overridden on the next edit with the value used to crop the image.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.LassoBoxLeft
member.summary: Optional: The initial left pixel postion of the "lasso" crop-selector when you have uploaded an image and want to crop it. ShowLasso must be set to true. If InputForm.CropImage is called from post_input.aspx, this value will be overridden on the next edit with the value used to crop the image.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.LassoBoxWidth
member.summary: Optional: The initial width of the "lasso" crop-selector when you have uploaded an image and want to crop it. ShowLasso must be set to true. Defaults to 100. If InputForm.CropImage is called from post_input.aspx, this value will be overridden on the next edit with the value used to crop the image.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.ShowAcquireParams.LassoBoxHeight
member.summary: Optional: The initial height of the "lasso" crop-selector when you have uploaded an image and want to crop it. ShowLasso must be set to true. Defaults to 100. If InputForm.CropImage is called from post_input.aspx, this value will be overridden on the next edit with the value used to crop the image.

member.value: A string that represents a name of a content field like "cropped_image"

member.summary: Used to control the wysiwyg XHTMLOutput feature. Setting this value to true will prevent the wysiwyg from converting the html to xhtml.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.IndentContent
member.summary: Formats the content based on html tags. Setting IndentContent to true will base the formatting on the html tags.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.DisableImageEditing
member.summary: Used to turn on and off the image editing tools. Setting this value to true will disable the image editing tools.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.DocumentNavigator
member.summary: Used to turn on and off the Document Navigator. Setting the value to false will turn off the document navigator.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.DesignEditTabs
member.summary: Used to turn on and off the Design/Edit tabs, whic hthe user can use to switch back and forth between code view and design view. Setting this value to false will disable this feature.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.brOnEnter
member.summary:
If this field is set to true, the wysiwyg will add a
when the enter button is pressed.

summary.para:
If set to true, content will be not automatically be wrapped with paragraph (

) tags if it has not been properly enclosed with block tags. See also .

Ephox does not recommend setting this attribute to true as it may cause invalid HTML to be generated. According to TinyMCE, not using P elements as root block can severly cripple the functionality of the editor.
If set to true, any custom tag specified outside of a block element will be automatically wrapped in a P tag (Ephox).

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.WordPasteOptions
member.summary: Turns on and off the Word Paste Options. When true, ephox will present the user with some paste options to sanitize the data coming in from a paste. This is useful when pasting from a word document.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.WordImportStyleOption
member.summary: Turns on and off the Word Import Style Option.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.HtmlPasteOptions
member.summary: Turns on or off the HtmlPasteOptions.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.HtmlImportStyleOption
member.summary: Turns on or off the HtmlImportStyleOption.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.ImageEditingOptions
member.summary: A list that determines what should be on the image editing toolbar. Possible values are: separator, rotateCCW, rotateCW, flipVertical, flipHorizontal, reflect, dropShadow, roundedCorners, and crop.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.HyperlinkList
member.summary: Represents a list of hyper links that contain both a link, the key, and a label, the value.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.WysiwygParams.MailtoList

member.summary: Sets the behavior when browsing to an image in the cms. Defaults to RelationShipType.Link which creates a link the image.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to display the "Insert Template" button. Clicking the button shows a list of WYSIWYG templates containing HTML fragments that may be inserted. All developer templates in the folder will show up as WYSIWYG templates. The asset label is the WYSIWYG template's name, and the asset body is the WYSIWYG template's HTML fragment.
member.value: True to show the button, false to hide it

member.value: The path of the template folder.

member.summary: Treat the related asset as a link to a CMS asset. If it is an upload file, it will automatically be saved into the CMS as an asset.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.IPublishing.IsGeneratingPublishLinks
member.summary: A read only property that tells whether asset.GetLink() will return a live link or a preview link. The rules are different depending on the context that you are in. NOTE: Does not apply to Util.ReplaceAttachments() or UploadedFile.GetLink() those always return a live link if package info is available.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.PanelEntry.SaveUploadedFile(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.UploadedFile)
member.summary:
Save an uploaded file with the given key to the panel in the context of the backing asset or current asset. Note: If this is in the PostInputContext and you go the panels from an InputForm, the data will be saved in the current asset.
Note: Do not include the post fix ":..." part of the name. Use the shortname "my_field", not "my_field:1"
member.param: The key where we are going to save this file
The UploadedFile object

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.PanelEntry.ClearUpload(System.String)
member.summary:
Clears the specified upload's meta data from the panel. If there is an array of uploads with this name, they are all removed unless a specific element is named.
Note: Do not include the post fix ":..." part of the name. Use the shortname "my_field", not "my_field:1"
member.param: The key used to identify the upload that you are clearing.

example.code: <% panel.ClearUpload("my_photo"); %>

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.PanelEntry.CreateThumbnail(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Img,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Creates a thumbnail of the specified size from the currently loaded image. A ThumbnailKey is required. The resulting image will be stored on the panel.
Note: Due to memory limitations, the pixel count of the source image cannot be more than 10 million.
Note: Do not include the post fix ":..." part of the name. Use the shortname "my_field", not "my_field:1"

member.param: The image to be used to create the thumbnail
The Key used to refer to the thumbnail later as part of the asset's content.
The width.
The height.
Optional: The Quality of the saved JPG as a percent. Higher numbers have higher quality, but also bigger sizes.
member.returns: An ImgResult.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.PanelEntry.CreateThumbnail(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.UploadedFile,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Creates a thumbnail of the specified size from the UploadedFile, it must be an image. A ThumbnailKey is required. The resulting image will be stored on the panel.
Note: Due to memory limitations, the pixel count of the source image cannot be more than 10 million.
Note: Do not include the post fix ":..." part of the name. Use the shortname "my_field", not "my_field:1"

member.param: The image to be used to create the thumbnail
The Key used to refer to the thumbnail later as part of the asset's content.
The width.
The height.
Optional: The Quality of the saved JPG as a percent. Higher numbers have higher quality, but also bigger sizes.
member.returns: An ImgResult.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.PanelEntry.CropImage(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Img,System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.LassoParams,System.Int32)
member.summary: Crop the current image using the box defined by x, y, xx, yy and scaling to width and height. Saving on the panel using thumbnailKey as a fieldname.
member.param: The image from which the result will be cropped
A key used to save the result
LassoParams that specify how to crop and scale the image
Optional: The quality of the resulting image as a percent. Defaults to 75
member.returns: ImgResult. Contains the new Img. Use HasError to check for errors.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.PanelEntry.CropImage(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.UploadedFile,System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.LassoParams,System.Int32)
member.summary: Crop the current image stored in the UploadedFile using the box defined by x, y, xx, yy and scaling to width and height. Saving on the panel using thumbnailKey as a fieldname.
member.param: UploadedFile that contains an Image
A key used to save the result
Optional: if panel is part of an InputForm in post input. LassoParams that specify how to crop and scale the image
Optional: The quality of the resulting image as a percent. Defaults to 75
member.returns: ImgResult. Contains the new Img. Use HasError to check for errors.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetPanelEntry.GetPanelsFromFolders(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset,System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetParams,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.AssetType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a sublist from the current panel using folder children. See asset.GetPanelsFromFolders
member.param: The folder whose children we will use to initialize the list
The name of the panel
Optional: Used like in GetFileList or GetFolderList to filter data, etc.
Optional: Can be used to get back only a specific type of child - file or folder, defaults to AssetType.Unspecified which returns both
Optional: The string that will be used to store the folder's label when we store the panel data. Use lower case. Defaults to panelName + ".label"
Optional: The string that will be used to store the folder's id when we store the panel data. Use lower case. Defaults to panelName + ".id"
member.returns: A List of AssetPanelEntry objects

member.summary: The CMS root folder that publishes to the root of the web application

member.summary: The id of the asset holding the package's site profile

member.summary: The gate keeper mode that determines how the auth module will behave. Can be Off, On, or PassThrough

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FedPublishingPackage.IsLocalInstall
member.summary: Refers to how the AuthModule will be installed on the site. If true, the module is installed locally to the web application in the bin folder and the modules are loaded one by one in the web.config. False would indicate the module is installed into the GAC and the modules are loaded globally into the server. The consequence of a true is that web.config files published to the site will automatically have the modules entries added and a false one would not. The default is false.

member.name: P:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.FedPublishingPackage.IgnoreRoster
member.summary: If this is set to true, no user list will be checked on the login. All users that are authenticated will be allowed in. Defaults to false

"); %>

member.name: T:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.SearchG2JsonParams
member.summary: Parameters to be used in SearchG2Context JsonParams property which generates a JSON string for updating content in a Search G2 Collection. See https://wiki.apache.org/solr/UpdateJSON for more details on the JSON format, this class will create the JSON for you. The collection updated is based on the Search G2 Server configured on the Publishing Package.

member.summary: Gets the string value. Only supports xml, csv, and txt files. If StringValue is called on an unsupported file type, such as an image it will return an empty string. member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Util.SetRenderTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Modifies the default value of the Render timeout. Normally used to give long running template more time to execute, or to make sure templates don't take over x # of seconds to execute. Should be used at top of template code. Cannot be set to the maximum set by the CMS, currently 900 seconds.
member.param: The new timeout value.

example.code: Util.SetRenderTimeout(100);

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Util.Crop(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Crops the specified string. If the string length is less than the crop length, the string will not be cropped. Crop tries to be smart about where it crops the string. Rather than croping a word midway through, it will crop at the right most space within the bounds set by the cropLength parameter. If a space does not exist within this section, it will crop the string at cropLength. appendEllipsis is an optional parameter that when set to true, will append an ellipsis to the end of the string. Since the ellipsis occupies 3 spaces, the cropLength will be adjusted by a factor of three. If the string is null, empty, or all whitespace, an empty string is returned.
member.param: The string to crop.
Max length of the string. Anything larger will result in a crop
if set to true it will append an ellipis to the resultant string and it will subtract 3 from the cropLength to compensate for the 3 dots
member.returns: Cropped version of the input string.

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Util.CreateListFromCsv(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Converts CSV file contents into a List of Dictionaries. Requires the first line in the data to be column headers.
member.param: CSV data with column headers on first line
Optional: The character to delimit the data. Defaults to ,
member.returns: A list of dictionaries. Each dictionary represents a row in the csv.

example.code:
<%
            List<Dictionary<string,string>> list = Util.CreateListFromCsv(testText, ',');
            foreach(Dictionary<string, string> dictionary in list)
            {
              string data = dictionary["colName1"];
            }
            %>

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Util.EscapeItem(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes html characters and all non-ASCII UTF-8 characters. If the string already contains escaped values, such as &, it will not escape the &.
member.param: The text.
member.returns: 'Escaped' HTML equivalent of the input string.
member.example:
Util.EscapeItem("apples & oranges"),
result: apples & oranges Escaping Japanese characters:
Util.EscapeItem("")
result: クラウンピーク

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Util.WrapText(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Wraps the text by inserting the delimiter into the text at the specified interval. WrapText will attempt to wrap the text at a word boundary in order preserve the readability of the text. As a result, some of the intervals will be less than the size provided, but never greater.

The size.
The delimiter.

");

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Util.ShortenWithBitly(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a shortened URL using bitly shortening service Uses first Bitly account from Connectors configuration screen that it finds. Useful if only one account is setup. Use the overload to specify a connector if there is more than one. Bitly connectors must have a username and password. The Server is optional. Leave it blank and http://api.bitly.com/v3 will be used. That is what is recommended.

member.returns: Shortened URL

URL to shorten
member.returns: Shortened URL

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Util.Editable(System.String,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.PanelEntry,CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset)
member.summary: Returns HTML attributes that enable the editing selection boxes for an asset field in the CMS. For use in output templates only. The attributes should be inserted into the wrapping HTML tag. If the editable element is inside a list panel, also include the . If the editable element is inside another asset, also include the
member.param: The name of the field
Optional: If the field is accessed from a , the . Defaults to null.
Optional: The asset that contains the field. Defaults to .
member.returns: A list of HTML tag attributes
member.remarks: For common field types, the CMS automatically handles the creation of editable field selection boxes, so fields can be selected in the CMS directly from the page preview. However, there are certain cases where the CMS cannot do this automatically. In such cases this method may be used instead. See the examples for details on how to use it.

member.summary:
Generic Page Fields
Note: This will create a section that includes an image upload control. The Image upload control is setup to create a thumbnail on upload.
Upload.aspx and post_input.aspx are not needed to manage the images.
The original image name will be "original" and the resulting thumbnail will be called "thumbnail" unless a different values are passed to the optional originalName or thumbnailName fields. The alt text field name will be thumbnailName + "_alt"
member.param: current asset, used to display additional controls if the template label is "Detail Page"
Optional: The fieldname to use for the original image. Default is "original"
Optional: The fieldname to use for the thumbnail. Default is "thumbnail"
Optional: The desired width. Default 95
Optional: The desired height. Default 63

example.code: ServicesInput.ShowDescInput(asset, "original_image", "thumbnail", 50, 50);

Enum to toggle the use of a WYSIWYG or a text box for the summary. Options are: ShowSummary.WYSIWYG or ShowSummary>Textbox. Default is ShowSummary.None.

member.summary: Called by RenderHyperLinkList to generate a HTML list of links (and/or sub-links)

List panels = asset.GetPanels("menu"); Out.WriteLine( ServicesOutput.BuildHyperLinkList(panels, "menu", childField: "submenu")); /*returns and outputs:

      • \r\n

    \n
    • \r\n
  • Link 2 yahoo\r\n
      \n
    • sublink 1 mail
      • \r\n
    \n
    • \r\n
\n \n */

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Services.ServicesUtil.NewLabelConform(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Conform new Asset Label to popup field.
Note: for use in new.aspx. Sync a given asset's content labelField with .Label text entered in "new" popup. Ignore if modelLabel was entered (prevents saving multiple assets with the "New Model Name" Label. Works best with post-input validation requiring this field and renaming asset to the content labelField on save.
member.param: The "new" asset being created.
The field to be synchronized with the pop-up label.
The Label name of the model (if unchanged, cancels the function).

example.code: ServicesUtil.NewLabelConform(asset, "page_label", "Content Page");

member.name: M:CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Services.ServicesUtil.CopyLabelConform(CrownPeak.CMSAPI.Asset,System.String)
member.summary:
Conform cloned asset Label to popup field.
Note: For use in copy.aspx. Sync a copied/cloned asset's content labelField with .Label text entered in "clone name" popup. Ignore if unchanged. Works best with post-input validation requiring this field and renaming asset to the content labelField on save.
member.param: The asset "copy" being created.
The field to be synchronized with the pop-up label.

example.code: ServicesUtil.CopyLabelConform(asset, "page_label");
